abstract.p: Status of injured New York Islanders goalie Rick DiPietro discussed (S)

block.p: The Islanders' No. 1 draft pick, Rick DiPietro, practiced yesterday in Syosset, N.Y., for the first time in full pads since pulling a groin muscle Wednesday, but Coach Butch Goring said it was unlikely he would start in goal against either the Rangers on Sunday or the Devils on Monday, in the final preseason game.
With less than two weeks till the season, Goring said it was important that John Vanbiesbrouck play in goal as much as possible.

The Islanders' No. 1 draft pick, Rick DiPietro, practiced yesterday in Syosset, N.Y., for the first time in full pads since pulling a groin muscle Wednesday, but Coach Butch Goring said it was unlikely he would start in goal against either the Rangers on Sunday or the Devils on Monday, in the final preseason game.
With less than two weeks till the season, Goring said it was important that John Vanbiesbrouck play in goal as much as possible.

''The unfortunate thing for Rick is that we haven't got a lot of games left,'' Goring said. ''It's not likely, but if he shows up, don't call me a liar. We want to continue to get as much ice time for Beezer at this point.
